title: Why can't we just have a Global Forum? Or at least a Global English Forum?
body:
At BEST different regions should probably just need their own Support section. Every region having their own forum is pretty overkill and just isolates them even more...

The whole idea of the internet is bridging the gap between different countries/continents. Splitting up a community like this is a bit counteractive...

replies.body:
On OCE boards, we have a tight community, we are all aware of eachother and who everyone plays and what their personalities are.

for example, I know CHEESYLEEKS likes to play the underplayed champs like Yorick Urgot etc. and would probably kick all our asses with The Headsmans Pride.
Meanwhile Klavinmour I know to be a jungle main, whose posts are detailed and clear, his arguments are factual and persuasive and he doesn't run blindly into a topic he doesn't know about, if i could choose anyone to be on a debate team with it would likely be him.
Meanwhile Stealthvortex88 is a great guy to play with, and if you ever need a talon main, he's your guy. 
and if Yasuo is mentioned anywhere, you can be sure Talon12 will be there.

and they people know me to be a guy who brings up issues peopel aren't comfortable about, usually blows tiny matters up into a big deal, and wont shut up about Azir Sol and Taliyah. 

This is possible because of our population size, theres enough of us to create new interesting posts every day, but still not enough of us for posts to be pushed off the front page in just a few hours. This allows conversations to be formed, with long discussions and disputes. 

But on the NA boards alone, a post made 10 hours ago, will have over 200 comments, thousands of views and will be 3 pages down from the home page _(so no one will ever look at it again)_ also, often if a post isn't either funny, or hating on a champ. it wont get up votes. So the only things you ever see on the home page is some random's meme, or a whole lot of complaints. Neither of which are community-building. 

If a post gets so many comments and are dropped off the home page (or never even reaches it) that quickly, its very difficult to have complex discussions, you have to trawl though 200 comments to find replies to yours.  I can only imagine how hectic the chinese/korean boards are. 

So if all the servers shares the same boards/forums, it would be a machine gun of posts, before you had a chance to read all of them, new posts would already have taken their place, and you'd feel alone in a sea of players, rather than in a community with regular players that you know. 

Not to mention the language barriers as well. I remember being on the NA server before they made the mexican one, and the sheer hate 90% of the player base had for the mexicans, purely because they couldn't understand eachother was unreal _(its easy to see why trump got in, people in America are not empathetic.)_ imagine how bad it would be when Americans have to talk to Germans and Chinese and Russians, and no one around the world can understand the majority of the posts because they'd all be in different languages that don't relate at all to where you are in the world. 

Not to mention posts looking for teammates, teams, and sever specific events would die off completely. Especially for servers with small numbers like ours, the chances of actually finding another OCE person with a team that needs you, would be very small. 

----------

Also the idea of the internet isn't to bridge the gap between countries, its purpose was to be a place to easily and reliably store and access information, as well as a medium for quicker communication. It's only a side effect of the way we use the internet in modern day, that causes people from multiple cultures to come into contact with eachother more. 

So while it sounds like a good and politically correct idea to have one global forum. The practicalities of it would soon put an end to it
I can see where you're coming from though. 

Although theres nothing stopping NA and EU people from coming here and talking to us, and theres nothing stopping us from going and talking to NA.
Some forums are region locked i believe, but probably because of population numbers.
you can post on NA boards with an OCE account, fyi
i enjoy having the different forums mostly because you can meet people in Oce on these forums rather than having 20 people in the comments saying "I can't add you for some reason" on the NA Boards.
